page.title: 10 A RUGELEY MINER AT LEA HALL
page.content: My dad is a pit deputy. At 11.00pm.he collects his cap lamp, safety lamp and self-rescuer. The last two protect him from dangerous gases. Deputies deploy the workmen and take charge of work carried out underground, including all aspects of health and safety. The men are expected look out for faulty equipment and natural dangers. By law the deputies have to write a report on all that happens during their shift. They report to the underground manager and the deputy going on the next shift, then it's shower and home for breakfast at 9.0am. Dad dislikes the constant dust, threat to health and safety and some-times finds the "man train" frightening He likes the friendly atmosphere and the fact that the weather doesn't affect his job. His father and grandfather were miners.
